body.name: The Newlyweds: A totally addictive psychological thriller full of twists

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This was such a great book!You will never see the end happening as it did. You’ve got to read this.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Not what I was expecting
reviews.reviewText: I am giving this book four stars because the last half is the most thrilling. I almost didn't finish reading this as the first half barely held my attention. What happens when two narcissistic people get together? Murder! Toni and Sunney deserve each other. Even if they don't know it. One has killed several times over and the other wants to kill, but can't.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Goodness gracious!!! This was a very intense book to read — but I couldn’t put it down. It was a bit more bloody than other books I have read as well. Nonetheless, I did enjoy reading the book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Within a few pages, I predicted what a twist would be and it came halfway through the book- I thought that it was weird and was upset there was so much book left, and then other twists occurred and they weren't good at all.There was alot of 'shocking' imagery that really didn't work for the story and just felt crammed in for cheap, morbid entertainment.Alot of different plot devices were used and none of them were used well. It was like the author scrambled to figure out how to make the story flow and just threw things in as a vain attempt. Example: the tuna can bit- like there was literally no other way that could have been brought about? Also the whole plotlines for Adler and Heather were just a bad crutch.The characters were unlikable. Toni with her twist at the end was lame and just used as an excuse for bad behavior to try to shock the audience or gain sympathy for this unrealistic character. Sunney because he was just wooden and boring.Technically speaking, there were spelling errors, clunky grammar, and the dialogue was not believable- people don't speak like that.There were a few odd word choices that took me out of the story because it was like the author wanted to impress with a few big vocabulary wordsMany bits could have been edited out or revised to flow better. There really was no need for the story to have been that long for what it was- it really needs more revisions, editing, cutting things to make the story more concise and trying to make the story flow without using cheap and clichéd plot devices to no avail.Overall this was not a good recommendation and a weak story to read.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Stayed up all night to finish this. I kept losing track of who the villain was. Or who the villain wasn't. Excellent thriller.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars The guy's name was Sunney Lane?
reviews.reviewText: I should have stopped right there, but I didn't.I would say this book is predictable, and it mostly is, except for the parts that don't make sense at all. Those parts are baffling and add to the general wtf-ness of the story. The characters, though meant to be full of surprises, are boring and one-dimensional. I'm not actually sure if I was supposed to like any of them. (I didn't.)Many of the word choices were extremely strange, like the author wanted to use a big word but didn't know one that worked so she took a took a swing anyway. They were close, but not quite there. "Amiss" is not a fancy way to say "missing", for example. A few times could be forgiven, but it happened so often on top of the utter absurdity of the story that it was all the more glaring.I really can't recommend this one, unfortunately. Perhaps the author's later works are more polished.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A must read!! Add this book to your list now!
reviews.reviewText: This story was so captivating. I didn't want to quit reading... Sonny and Toni seem like the perfect couple, but this is not the case. Totally mind blowing twists. I don't want to spoil anything.... You will have to read this one for yourself!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This book warned us at the beginning and indeed it was gory. I did finish it,
